intro: Saxifraga rigoi subsp. rigoi, commonly known as the alpine saxifrage, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It typically grows in rocky and alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. The plant features upright, hairy stems that bear clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are usually basal, rosette-like, and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs. Saxifraga rigoi subsp. rigoi is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
